Name: Stela of Nes-Wen-Nefer
Description: The stela of Nes-wen-nefer is decorated on both faces. The recto, or front, bears figures and text in low relief and the winged sun disk painted in red. Below, the Apis bull is standing on a red plinth, or slab, with a red sun disk between its horns. The figure is drawn in black. The semi-Hieratic text, inscribed in red ink on the lower part of the recto, continues on the verso, or back, and gives the titles, names and genealogy of the dedicator.
